pull.title: [doc][trivial] Remove miniupnpc build notes from build-unix
pull.body:
Users shouldn’t have the impression that we’re using/constrained to an
older version of miniupnpc, so update the doc to the latest version.

[skip-ci]

events.body: Probably we shouldn't mention a version at all there - goes out of date too soon, especially with miniupnp :-)

Taking a step back here:
- Why do we need specific instructions about building upnp at all? Those should be documented by the miniupnp project.
- Using upnp isn't encouraged...
- People that build from source generally know how to set up port forwardings.

My new proposal: let's remove this section. Optionally replace with a pointer to the miniupnpc docs.
I agree with Wladimir (the main reason for me is the second one).
Updated to remove the build instructions entirely.

rename.to: [doc][trivial] Remove miniupnpc build notes from build-unix

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -137,8 +137,8 @@ turned off by default.  See the configure options for upnp behavior desired:
 
 To build:
 
-	tar -xzvf miniupnpc-1.6.tar.gz
-	cd miniupnpc-1.6
+	tar -xzvf miniupnpc-x.x.tar.gz
+	cd miniupnpc-x.x
 	make
 	sudo su
 	make install
comments.body: another change could be: `sudo make install`?

comments.body:
Hmm, thinking about it, I don't like recommending installing it globally at all
E.g. the berkeleydb build instructions describe how to install to a local dir and use it there
